content:
Hi all,

I've been working to understand the backend of Lean4 and how it is built, in order to see if I can't work on doing side-channel analysis of Lean4. I was wondering, what is the initialize_Init function? I've tried looking for a function declaration, but I can't seem to find it, at least not initially. Is this generated in the later stages using CMake? I also think in the nightly builds its declaration is stored in the libleanshared .so file, and if it is, is there any way I can find out what else is in the .so file?

If there is any additional information I need to provide, I'd be happy to help! Thanks!

It is a function that gets auto generated by the compiler to call the other initialization functions of the Init module and do other possible initialization work for Init. In general each Lean module will get an automatically generated initialize_$MODULE function to do setup work for the modules such as calling other module's initializers, setting up the values of extracted closed terms etc.
You can find the function declaration itself in the stage0 directory
Thank you both so much! I was able to find it!
Stone Olguin has marked this topic as resolved.
